trans-unit.source: An inline-level flow content element intended to contain a run of formatted or unformatted text.

Starting in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run> object is a dependency property, which means that you can bind the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text%2A> property to a data source.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text%2A> property fully supports one-way binding in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader> and other controls that display read-only text.
For more information about data binding, see [Data Binding Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-overview.md).
Binding text to a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run> object contained within <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RichTextBox> is not supported.
Editing operations within the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RichTextBox> may cause the binding to be cleared.
Initializes a new, default instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run"></xref> class, taking a specified string as the initial contents of the text run.
A string specifying the initial contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run"></xref> object.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run"></xref> class, taking a specified string as the initial contents of the text run, and a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> specifying an insertion position for the text run.
A string specifying the initial contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> specifying an insertion position at which to insert the text run after it is created, or `null` for no automatic insertion.

Returns a value that indicates whether or not the effective value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text"></xref> property should be serialized during serialization of a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run"></xref> object.
A serialization service manager object for this object.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text"></xref> property should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
manager is `null`.
Gets or sets the unformatted text contents of this text <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run"></xref>.

Starting in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run> object is a dependency property, which means that you can bind the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text%2A> property to a data source.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text%2A> property fully supports one-way binding in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader> and other controls that display read-only text.
For more information about data binding, see [Data Binding Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-overview.md).
Binding text to a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run> object contained within <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RichTextBox> is not supported.
Editing operations within the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RichTextBox> may cause the binding to be cleared.
A string that specifies the unformatted text contents of this text <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run"></xref>.
The default is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text"></xref> dependency property.
